entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report and a bonus: StackOverflow top 20 questions of 2016.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: doug_bell
entries.text: Doug presents the API for getting results data from CPAN Testers, which he started working on at the MetaCPAN hackathon, meta::hack.
entries.title: CPAN Testers has a new API

entries.author: peter_sergeant
entries.text: Pete presents XML::Writer::Lazy, which he created to address things he didn't like with XML::Writer.
entries.title: Yak Shaving: XML::Writer edition

entries.author: jonas_bromso_nielsen
entries.text: Jonas suggests that if you have CPAN distributions (with github repo's), then you might want to opt in for your distributions to be candidates for assigning in the CPAN Pull Request Challenge. And if you do, you could add github issues and tag them with 'cpan-prc-2017'.
entries.title: CPAN Pull Request Challenge 2017

entries.author: dominique_dumont
entries.text: Dominique has released Dist::Zilla::App::Command::authordebs, which introduces a new authordebs command. It lists the debian packages for the upriver dependencies.
entries.title: New dzil command to install author dependencies as Debian packages

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: The final P5P summary of the year, the highlight of which is that Perl 5.25.8 is now available.
entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: December 19th-25th

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor introduces type coercion in Moose.
entries.title: Moose: coerce value to a subtype

entries.author: makoto_nozaki
entries.text: A summary of Perl Foundation activity in the fourth quarter of 2016.
entries.title: TPF 2016Q4 Activity Report

entries.author: randy_j_ray
entries.text: After 2 years break in blogging, Randy made a new thing in Perl: YASF, or Yet Another String Formatter
entries.title: I Made a New Thing in Perl

header:
Unsurprisingly, since this issue covers Christmas and the New Year,
we don't have many articles this week.
You can spend the time saved thinking about your Perl projects
for 2017!
Best wishes for the coming year from all of the editors.
subject: Happy New Year!
